alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Macon; Rutherford; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 24 at 10:59PM CDT until March 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Smith County in Middle Tennessee... Eastern Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Rutherford County in Middle Tennessee... Southern Sumner County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... Southwestern Macon County in Middle Tennessee... Trousdale County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1058 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lakewood to La Vergne to 12 miles east of Spring Hill, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Gallatin, Lebanon, Carthage, Hartsville, Madison, Hendersonville, Smyrna, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, Nolensville, Lakewood, Watertown, Hermitage, Walterhill, Rural Hill, Belinda City, Old Hickory and South Carthage. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Davidson; Macon; Rutherford; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale; Williamson; Wilson
